column2: ¿~qŭid multiplicáti sùnt qŭi trìbulant me~? Multi insùrgunt advèrsum me. ^ Why
column4: are they multiplied that afflict me~? many are they who rise up against me.

column2: «~Non èst salûs ìpsi in Deo ejus.~» ^ Many say to my soul
column3: "There is no salvation for him in his God."

column5: et exáltans caput meum. ^ But thou
column9: and the lifter up of my head.

column2: et exaŭdívit me de mònte sancto suo. ^ I have cried to the Lord with my voice
column3: and he hath heard me from his holy hill.
qŭia Dòminus suscépit me. ^ I have slept and have taken my rest
column5: because the Lord hath protected me.

column1: 7 ^ Non timébo mìllia pòpuli circumdántîs me. Exsùrge Dòmine~; salvum me fac Deus meus. ^ I will not fear thousands of the people surrounding me. Arise

8 ^ Qŭóniam tu percussìsti òmnes adversántes mìhi sine caŭsa~; dentes peccatórum contrivìsti. ^ For thou hast struck all them who are my adversaries without cause~; thou hast broken the teeth of sinners.

column2: et super pòpulum tuum benedìctio tua. ^ Salvation is of the Lord
column3: and thy blessing is upon thy people.
